forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 58. West southwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 66, with temperatures falling to around 64 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 6 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.

weather_report:
As the night drifts softly into dawn, a veil of clouds clings to the air in Downtown San Francisco, offering a gentle embrace with a low temperature around 58 degrees. The winds whisper from the west-southwest, brushing against the cool dampness that often defines the city's start. When morning breaks, expect a delightful transformation; the clouds will gradually recede, revealing mostly sunny skies. Temperatures will awaken slowly, peaking near 66 before settling back to a refreshing 64 by the afternoon. The southwest winds, light yet lively, will serve as a reminder of nature's touch, with occasional gusts dancing through the streets.

Given the shifting weather, one might find a light jacket or a cozy sweater to be their best companion as the day unfolds. Early morning walks along the waterfront could be rewarding, with the promise of sunshine casting a warm glow over familiar landscapes. As the sun climbs higher, consider savoring a quiet moment in one of the city's parks, perhaps enjoying a book or simply watching the world drift by. The clarity of the day, nourished by the absence of dense fog, opens a canvas for exploration and leisure—a reminder that even the most mundane moments can blossom into something quietly extraordinary.
